SEARCH
Package com.example.atlasevents.utils

Class InputValidator

java.lang.Object
com.example.atlasevents.utils.InputValidator
public class InputValidator extends Object
Utility class for validating user inputs throughout the Atlas Events application.

Provides centralized validation logic for all input types including strings, numbers, dates, and combined form validations. All validation methods return a InputValidator.ValidationResult object containing validation status and error messages.

See Also:
  • InputValidator.ValidationResult

    • validateDateSelected

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateDateSelected(Date date, String fieldName)
      Validates that a date has been selected and is not in the past.
      Parameters:
      date - The date to validate
      fieldName - The name of the date field (for error messages)
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateTimeSelected

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateTimeSelected(Integer hour, Integer minute, String fieldName)
      Validates that a time has been selected.
      Parameters:
      hour - The hour to validate (0-23)
      minute - The minute to validate (0-59)
      fieldName - The name of the time field (for error messages)
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

      Parameters:

      endDate - The end date to validate
      startFieldName - The name of the start date field (for error messages)
      endFieldName - The name of the end date field (for error messages)
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateEmail

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateEmail(String email)
      Validates an email address.

      Checks that the email is not empty, within length limits, and matches a valid email format pattern.

      Parameters:
      email - The email to validate
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validatePhone

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validatePhone(String phone, boolean required)
      Validates a phone number.

      Checks that the phone number (if provided) is within length limits and matches a valid phone format pattern. Phone numbers are optional in some contexts (e.g., sign-up).

      Parameters:
      phone - The phone number to validate
      required - Whether the phone number is required
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateEmailOrPhone

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateEmailOrPhone(String emailOrPhone)
      Validates an email or phone number (for sign-in).

      Accepts either a valid email address or a valid phone number.

      Parameters:
      emailOrPhone - The email or phone to validate
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validatePassword

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validatePassword(String password)
      Validates a password.

      Checks that the password meets minimum length requirements and contains at least one letter. Additional strength requirements can be added.

      Parameters:
      password - The password to validate
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validatePasswordOptional

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validatePasswordOptional(String password)
      Validates a password that may be optional (for profile updates).

      If the password is empty, returns success (password won't be updated). If provided, validates it meets requirements.

      Parameters:
      password - The password to validate
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateMessage

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateMessage(String message, int maxLength)
      Validates a message/notification text.

      Checks that the message is not empty and within maximum length limits.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to validate
      maxLength - Maximum allowed length
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateLocation

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateLocation(String location)
      Validates a location/address field.

      Checks that the location is not empty and within maximum length limits.

      Parameters:
      location - The location to validate
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateDescription

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateDescription(String description, int maxLength)
      Validates a description field (optional).

      If provided, checks that the description is within maximum length limits.

      Parameters:
      description - The description to validate
      maxLength - Maximum allowed length
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validatePositiveInteger

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validatePositiveInteger(String value, String fieldName)
      Validates that a string represents a positive integer.

      Safely parses the string and checks that it's a positive integer.

      Parameters:
      value - The string value to validate
      fieldName - The name of the field (for error messages)
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateIntegerRange

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateIntegerRange(String value, int min, int max, String fieldName)
      Validates that a string represents an integer within a specified range.

      Safely parses the string and checks that it's within the min-max range.

      Parameters:
      value - The string value to validate
      min - Minimum allowed value (inclusive)
      max - Maximum allowed value (inclusive)
      fieldName - The name of the field (for error messages)
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validatePositiveIntegerOptional

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validatePositiveIntegerOptional(String value, String fieldName)
      Validates that a string represents an optional positive integer.

      If the value is empty, returns success (field is optional). If provided, validates it's a positive integer.

      Parameters:
      value - The string value to validate
      fieldName - The name of the field (for error messages)
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateDateRange

      Parameters:

      endDate - The end date
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateRegistrationPeriod

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateRegistrationPeriod(Date regStartDate, Date regEndDate, Date eventDate)
      Validates the registration period relative to the event date.

      Ensures: - Registration start date is before registration end date - Registration end date is before event date

      Parameters:
      regStartDate - Registration start date
      regEndDate - Registration end date
      eventDate - Event date
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message

    • validateTime

      public static InputValidator.ValidationResult validateTime(String time)
      Validates a time string format.

      Checks that the time string matches the expected format (hh:mm a).

      Parameters:
      time - The time string to validate
      Returns:
      ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message
